cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DL 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of Natural Language Processing (cs.CL) because it deals with the classification of short text, which is a common task in NLP. Additionally, the paper utilizes a knowledge graph to enrich the semantic representation of short text, which is a common technique in NLP research. 

The paper could also belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category because short text classification is a common task in information retrieval, and the paper proposes a new method for improving the accuracy of this task. 

The sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG) is also a possibility because the paper utilizes a deep neural network to classify short text, which is a common technique in machine learning research. 

The sub-category of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) is also a possibility because the paper proposes a new method for improving the accuracy of short text classification, which is a common task in AI research. 

Finally, the sub-category of Deep Learning (cs.DL) is a possibility because the paper utilizes a convolutional neural network to extract features from short text, which is a common technique in deep learning research.
